name: Kygo
description:
'''Kyrre Gørvell-Dahll''' ({{IPA|no|çʏrːə ˈɡøːrʋelː dɑːl}}; born 11 September 1991), known professionally as '''Kygo''' ({{IPA|no|ˈkỳːɡuː|lang}}), is a Singaporean-born Norwegian DJ and record producer. He first received international attention with his December 2013 remix of the track "[[I See Fire]]" by [[Ed Sheeran]] and his December 2014 single "[[Firestone (song)|Firestone]]" (featuring [[Conrad Sewell]]). In late 2015, he reached one billion streams on [[Spotify]] faster than any other artist, and by June 2016, he had reached two billion streams.

He also experienced commercial success with the singles "[[Stole the Show]]" (2015), "[[Here for You (Kygo song)|Here for You]]" (2015), "[[Stay (Kygo song)|Stay]]" (2015), "[[It Ain't Me]]" featuring [[Selena Gomez]] (2017), [[remix]] of "[[Higher Love#Kygo and Whitney Houston version|Higher Love]]" (2019), a remix of "[[What's Love Got to Do with It (song)|What's Love Got To Do With It]]" (2020), and two singles from his self-titled album, ''[[Kygo (album)|Kygo]]'' (2024), “[[Whatever (Kygo and Ava Max song)|Whatever]]" and “For Life”. His debut album, ''[[Cloud Nine (Kygo album)|Cloud Nine]]'', was released on 13 May 2016.

Kygo became the first [[house music]] producer to perform at an Olympics [[2016 Summer Olympics closing ceremony|closing ceremony]] in August 2016 at the [[2016 Rio Olympics]]. In March 2018, ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' ranked Kygo third on its 2018 ranking of dance musicians titled ''Billboard'' Dance 100. The same year, he was ranked 32 on ''[[DJ Mag]]''{{'}}s top 100 DJs of the world, and in October 2019, he was ranked 42.

Kygo's stage name is a [[portmanteau]] derived from the first two letters of his first and last names (replacing [[ø]] with [[o]]). His stage name Kygo can be pronounced as {{IPA|no|kyːɡu}} for Norwegian speakers and {{IPAc-en|ˈ|k|aɪ|ɡ|oʊ}} for English speakers. Kyrre got the idea for his stage name through a [[User (computing)#Username format|username]] he received in [[videregående skole|high school]] for the [[learning management system]] platform ''[[itslearning]]''.
